title: Information Disclosure - Unauthenticated Exposure of Server Process Information
description: The application's root endpoint (/) publicly exposes detailed server process information without requiring any authentication. The page displays a table containing running processes with sensitive details including UIDs/usernames, process IDs (PIDs), CPU and memory usage percentages, virtual and resident memory sizes, process status codes, start times, and full command lines with arguments. The information is automatically refreshed every 5 seconds, allowing continuous monitoring of system processes. This vulnerability enables attackers to perform reconnaissance by identifying running services, discovering application paths and file locations, analyzing command-line arguments for sensitive configuration, understanding system architecture and deployed components, and identifying potential attack vectors.
impact: Critical information disclosure allowing attackers to enumerate running services, discover application paths, and identify potential security weaknesses. The exposure of process details, command-line arguments, and system architecture facilitates reconnaissance attacks and enables targeted exploitation. Sensitive configuration information may be visible in process arguments, further compromising system security.
evidence:
POC execution confirmed vulnerability:
- HTTP GET request to / returns HTTP 200 without authentication
- Response contains HTML table with process information
- Process fields detected: UID, PID, CPU, Memory, VSZ, RSS, STAT, START, COMMAND
- Application-specific processes visible: daytona user processes, /usr/local/bin/daytona binary with full path
- Auto-refresh mechanism detected: meta refresh set to 5 seconds
- No authentication headers required for access
- Full process listing exposed including command-line arguments

POC execution output shows:
[+] VULNERABILITY CONFIRMED: Root endpoint is accessible without authentication (HTTP 200)
[+] Process table found in response
[+] Process information fields detected (UID, PID, CPU, Memory, etc.)
[+] Application-specific process information found with daytona processes
[+] Auto-refresh enabled detected in page with 5 second refresh interval
remediation:
1. Implement robust authentication and authorization checks on the / endpoint to restrict access to authenticated users only
2. Enforce role-based access control (RBAC) to limit process information display to authenticated administrators
3. Sanitize displayed process information - do not expose full command-line arguments which may contain sensitive configuration
4. Minimize process details displayed - show only essential information (process name, status) and remove CPU/memory/path details
5. Remove or significantly increase the auto-refresh interval to reduce continuous exposure of system state
6. Implement security headers: X-Frame-Options: DENY, Content-Security-Policy, X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
7. Consider moving process monitoring functionality behind a protected administrative interface
8. Add request authentication tokens and session validation
references: OWASP A04:2021 - Insecure Design, CWE-434: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type, CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor, CWE-862: Missing Authorization
toolCallDescription: Documenting confirmed information disclosure vulnerability with working POC that demonstrates unauthenticated access to server process information
